    School of Pharmacy Career Office 



The Career Office offers resources for students and alumni that are tailored to the pharmacy graduate degree programs. We collaborate with academic departments, employers, and the community to instill the methods of career management that will empower students to develop appropriate lifelong career decision-making strategies. We offer assistance with formulating career plans, implementing post-graduation objectives, and assistance in preparation for a wide range of practice settings.
CUSP offers a range of undergraduate and graduate programs that can launch a variety of careers in the exciting field of pharmacy.
Please do not hesitate to reach out to me for assistance.
 







Katie Fugnetti
Career Specialist
(714) 516-5413
fugnetti@chapman.eduÂ 




CAREER RESOURCES


Toggle Section





                                                Students

                                                

We are fully committed to helping our students prepare for their future careers in the field of pharmacy. Our goal is to prepare our students for every aspect of the application process and ensure they stand out to employers. Some of the resources that we offer to our students include:

Document Templates
Resume/CV Assistance
Cover Letter/Letter of Intent Review
Employment Document Review (jobs, fellowships, residencies)
Mock Interviews
Career Events
Career Exploration & Assessment
Networking & Event Strategies (Professional Event Training)
Goal-Setting & Personal Branding Advice
Job Listings







                                                Alumni 

                                                

The Chapman University School of Pharmacy’s alumni have been essential to the development and advancement of the school. They have been, and will continue to be, vital members of the Chapman University School of Pharmacy family. We are fully committed to the professional growth of our alumni as they advance in their careers. Some of the resources and opportunities we can provide our alumni, in addition to those listed in Student Resources, include:

Continued Access to CUSP Career Office
Membership to CUSP Community Resources
Potential Mentorship Opportunities
Career- & School-Related Events
Networking Opportunities







                                                Employers

                                                

The Chapman University School of Pharmacy is looking to connect our students and alumni to strong, innovative employers. One of our goals in the Career Office is to establish more meaningful relationships with companies, organizations, and individuals who will be making a difference within the pharmacy and health care fields. The Chapman University School of Pharmacy programs are preparing the next generation of leaders in pharmacy, and we would be interested in helping employers find the perfect match for any job opportunities. Some of the resources that we provide employers include:

Campus Visits
Information Session Presentations
Personalized Candidate Recruitment
On-Campus Interview Opportunities
Career Showcase Events
Job Postings on Career Portal
Alumni Network Connections
